content: quote: Perhaps the loss of a mother ship would awaken them to the dangers of poking the eagle. You indirectly raise an interesting question ... I understand that it is a big sea, little boats ... and that the Navy can't be everywhere. I would think, though, that a satellite or so properly positioned could zoom in on the "mother ships" and track one when it leaves port until it drops its smaller craft. That, IMHO, should be enough of a provocation to put a size twelve boot below the waterline ... of the mother ship.
quote: Perhaps the loss of a mother ship would awaken them to the dangers of poking the eagle.

content: "The latest seizures were the Lebanese-owned cargo ship MV Sea Horse, the Greek-managed bulk carrier MV Irene E.M. and two Egyptian fishing boats. Maritime officials said the Irene carried 21 to 23 Filipino crew and the International Maritime Bureau reported 36 fishermen, all believed to be Egyptian, on the two boats. " Some "retaliation" They would have done this anyway. Not 1 US Flagged Ship. Let their own countries worry about them, we did our part saving our crew. I don't see why Egypt has not done anything either. The canal is a big income for them.

content: First of all, America is becoming a coward in all activities. We treat these pirates as some shoplifter that needs the full strenght of the Navy to counteract their actions and provide a show of force for each ship. I'm sure they tremble at the thought of our Navy begging them not to harm anyone or there may be serious consequences in the court of law. After our justice serving lawyers handled each case for over a year or so, we compassionate PC citizens would treat these 16 to 19 year olds as a college prank that got out of hand. We need to feel sorry for the poor, uneducated people from the region and provide for their suffering. We really should use our assets of satellite, UAVs, and other intelligence sources to locate the mother ships and destroy them with no prisoners. Or to do it all in one sweep, by sending 2-4 B-52s on a sea surveillance mission armed with 500 or 2,000 pound laser guided weapons. When we locate mother ships or any of the chase ships far out to sea, we sink them. Any pirate vessels leaving port would also be sunk. Now other nations would be upset with our actions, but when have we become concerned at what other countires think about the US.

content: You just have to shake your head at the Somali pirate mentality. The just captured Lebanese-owned cargo ship MV Sea Horse Picks up food aid in India... and delivers it to the starving in Somalia. And they had to go out and capture it as it was leaving Somalia empty. Those boys aren't long on brains are they. Also this morning the French took out a pirate mother ship and captured 11. quote: The raid thwarted the sea bandits' planned attack on a Liberian-registered vessel Way to go France!

We need to feel sorry for the poor, uneducated people from the region and provide for their suffering. We really should use our assets of satellite, UAVs, and other intelligence sources to locate the mother ships and destroy them with no prisoners. Or to do it all in one sweep, by sending 2-4 B-52s on a sea surveillance mission armed with 500 or 2,000 pound laser guided weapons. When we locate mother ships or any of the chase ships far out to sea, we sink them. Any pirate vessels leaving port would also be sunk. Now other nations would be upset with our actions, but when have we become concerned at what other countires think about the US.
title: Pirate retaliation  4 more ships seized

content: So what do we do now that things have changed: Pirates attack an American flagged ship this morning- they didn't try to board it, they ATTACKED it with RPG's and assault rifles then sped away. Even the NBC report this morning showed a 'mothership' in port. We know where they are, and their intentions, WHY aren't we DOING something about it ?
reply: So what do we do now that things have changed: Pirates attack an American flagged ship this morning- they didn't try to board it, they ATTACKED it with RPG's and assault rifles then sped away. Even the NBC report this morning showed a 'mothership' in port. We know where they are, and their intentions, WHY aren't we DOING something about it ?
title: Pirate retaliation  4 more ships seized

content: quote: Originally posted by Motive25: quote: Originally posted by I_M_Qwerty: quote: Perhaps the loss of a mother ship would awaken them to the dangers of poking the eagle. You indirectly raise an interesting question ... I understand that it is a big sea, little boats ... and that the Navy can't be everywhere. I would think, though, that a satellite or so properly positioned could zoom in on the "mother ships" and track one when it leaves port until it drops its smaller craft. That, IMHO, should be enough of a provocation to put a size twelve boot below the waterline ... of the mother ship. Assuming the technical capability existed, which other priority targets would you like it diverted from: Afghanistan, Iraq, Iran, Pakistan, or North Korea? It's your call... Since you asked ... North Korea ...

content: Who says assets must be diverted. What if surveillance assets that you don't (and won't) know about are already there. A lot of what-ifs there, but it's not a huge stretch to assume that the Navy is interested in what the somali pirates are up to. We operate a LOT around the horn, both on land and at sea.
reply: Who says assets must be diverted. What if surveillance assets that you don't (and won't) know about are already there. A lot of what-ifs there, but it's not a huge stretch to assume that the Navy is interested in what the somali pirates are up to. We operate a LOT around the horn, both on land and at sea.
title: Pirate retaliation  4 more ships seized

content: You just have to shake your head at the Somali pirate mentality. The just captured Lebanese-owned cargo ship MV Sea Horse Picks up food aid in India... and delivers it to the starving in Somalia. And they had to go out and capture it as it was leaving Somalia empty. Those boys aren't long on brains are they. Also this morning the French took out a pirate mother ship and captured 11. quote: The raid thwarted the sea bandits' planned attack on a Liberian-registered vessel Way to go France!
quote: The raid thwarted the sea bandits' planned attack on a Liberian-registered vessel
reply: You just have to shake your head at the Somali pirate mentality. Way to go France!
